title: Shark

properties.name: description
properties.value: Sharks are a type of fish that can be obtained by cooking a raw shark on a fire or cooking range, requiring level 80 Cooking and granting 210 experience when successful. Players may burn a shark while cooking one, resulting in a burnt shark; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Sharks do not stop burning on normal ranges and fires at level 99, unless the player is wearing the Cooking cape.

This article is about cooked shark. For the raw form, see Raw shark.
 This article has a money making guide: Cooking raw sharks.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.

Advanced data
Item ID385

Sharks are a type of fish that can be obtained by cooking a raw shark on a fire or cooking range, requiring level 80 Cooking and granting 210 experience when successful. Players may burn a shark while cooking one, resulting in a burnt shark; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Sharks do not stop burning on normal ranges and fires at level 99, unless the player is wearing the Cooking cape.

Sharks are fished with harpoons which requires 76 Fishing, but they can also be fished barehanded, which requires level 96 Fishing, level 76 Strength, and partial completion of Barbarian Training. Raw sharks can be caught at most net/harpoon fishing spots; some locations include the Fishing Guild, Catherby, and Burgh de Rott.

Sharks can also be obtained from Bardur, who is located in the Waterbirth Island Dungeon, in exchange for a Fremennik blade, a Fremennik helm, or a Fremennik shield.

Sharks are a popular food item in Old School RuneScape, as they are high-healing (20 Hitpoints) and can be easily caught in large amounts. Because of this sharks are widely used for player killing, general monster killing and quests.

{{External|rs|rsc}} {{Otheruses|cooked shark|the raw form|Raw shark}} {{HasMMG|Cooking raw sharks}} {{Infobox Item |name = Shark |image = [[File:Shark.png]] |release = [[27 February]] [[2002]] |update = Latest RuneScape News (27 February 2002) |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |placeholder = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |noteable1 = Yes |edible = Yes |options = Eat |destroy = Drop |examine = I'd better be careful eating this. |value = 170 |weight = 0.650 |exchange = Yes |id = 385 }} [[File:Shark detail.png|left|150px]] '''Sharks''' are a type of [[fish]] that can be obtained by cooking a [[raw shark]] on a [[fire]] or [[cooking range]], requiring level 80 [[Cooking]] and granting 210 experience when successful. Players may burn a shark while cooking one, resulting in a [[burnt shark]]; the [[burn rate]] while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Sharks do not stop burning on normal ranges and fires at level 99, unless the player is wearing the [[Cooking cape]]. Sharks are fished with [[harpoon]]s which requires 76 [[Fishing]], but they can also be fished [[Barbarian Fishing|barehanded]], which requires level 96 Fishing, level 76 [[Strength]], and partial completion of [[Barbarian Training]]. Raw sharks can be caught at most [[Fishing spot (big net, harpoon)|net/harpoon fishing spots]]; some locations include the [[Fishing Guild]], [[Catherby]], and [[Burgh de Rott]]. Sharks can also be obtained from [[Bardur]], who is located in the [[Waterbirth Island Dungeon]], in exchange for a [[Fremennik blade]], a [[Fremennik helm]], or a [[Fremennik shield]]. Sharks are a popular [[food]] item in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'', as they are high-healing (20 [[Hitpoints]]) and can be easily caught in large amounts. Because of this sharks are widely used for [[player killing]], general [[monster killing]] and [[quests]]. ==Creation== {{Recipe |skill1 = Cooking |skill1lvl = 80 |skill1boostable = Yes |skill1exp = 210 |members = Yes |ticks = 4 |facilities = Cooking range |mat1 = Raw shark |output1 = Shark }} ===Cooking chance=== {{Skilling success chart|label=Shark cooking chance|showbefore=no |label1=Fire|low1=1|high1=202|req1=80|color1=orange|image1=Firemaking icon.png |label2=Range|low2=1|high2=232|req2=80|color2=saddlebrown|image2=Cooking range icon.png |label3=Gauntlets|low3=15|high3=270|req3=80|color3=grey|image3=Cooking gauntlets.png |label4=Hosidius +5%|low4=13|high4=244|req4=80|color4=red|image4=Cooking range icon.png |label5=Hosidius +10%|low5=26|high5=257|req5=80|color5=blue|image5=Cooking range icon.png |label6=Hosidius +5%, gauntlets|low6=27|high6=282|req6=80|color6=#ffcccb|image6=Cooking gauntlets.png |label7=Hosidius +10%, gauntlets|low7=40|high7=295|req7=80|color7=#ccccff|image7=Cooking gauntlets.png }} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Shark}} ===Shop locations=== {{Store locations list|Shark}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 20 September 2018 |update = Deadman Experience Cap Increase and Quality of Life Changes |poll = |change = The [[value]] was changed from 300 to 170 so that it would appear below more valuable items when on the ground. }} {{Subject changes |date = 17 July 2007 |update = Game Improvements (July 2007) |change = The item was graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Shark detail (historical).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Shark detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Shark (historical).png|center]] |[[File:Shark.png|center]] |- |29 March 2004 ⁠–
